chargeHist.descr: Exposing Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts to a Child

result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph S Graf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Lewd, Lascivious Behavior-Exposure, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must report to probation by Wednesday, October 29, 2014 at 4:00 PM.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must have no contact with the victim during the probation period.

Expunction will be granted by the court if no underlying diagnosis is found, all court obligations, supervision fees and restitution are paid in full and upon defendant's successful completion of probation or sentence.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

11/28/14 AMENDED: MUST SUBMIT DNA SAMPLE.

Defendant Joseph S Graf in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Russell E. Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State moves to amend charge to lewd behavior 944.20(1)(b) Class A misdemeanor.  Court grants amendment.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented.  Court questions defendant.  Defendant pleads Guilty to amended charge.  Court accepts and finds Guilty.
State relates.  Victim's rights have been complied with.  
Attorney Raymond relates.
Defendant addresses Court.

Court relates and orders: Withheld sentence.
Probation - 1 year.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.  
Must have no contact with victim during probation period.
Expunction will be granted by the court if no underlying diagnosis found, all court obligations, supervision fees and restitution are paid in full and upon defendant's successful completion of probation or sentence.
Community Service - 20 hours.  
Court Costs.
Must report to Probation by Wednesday 10/29/2014 by 4:00 pm.

Defendant Joseph S Graf in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Russell E. Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts Defendant's waiver, finds probable cause and binds over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for October 27, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.  

Must have no contact with ARB  d/o/b 6/18/1999 
Must have no unsupervised contact with any juvenile females.

Defendant Joseph S Graf in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Defendant Joseph S Graf in custody.  Russell E. Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Qualifies for PD. Time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 7, 2014 at 11:30 am.
